revised_title: An Experiment on the Quantity of Air Produced from Gunpowder Fired in Common Air
tldr: The author conducts an experiment to determine the quantity of air produced from a grain weight of gunpowder fired in common air. The experiment involves measuring the space occupied by the expanding gas using water displacement. The results suggest that the space occupied by the gas is nearly equal to the bulk of 11 grains of gunpowder, indicating that the space deserted by the water is not supplied with real air.
